intro: Adinandra rubiginosa, commonly known as the red-stemmed adenandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and small, clustered leaves. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Adinandra rubiginosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
